result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Klotz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber and Good Time.
Consecutive to: 15CM151

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $100.00 cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

judgments.dispoDesc: Uncharged retail theft is dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt: Body only - Statewide.  If arrested, Court orders defendant to serve six (6) days jail.
Body only - Statewide.  If arrested, Court orders defendant to serve six (6) days jail.

Defendant James E. Klotz not in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests body only warrant.  Statewide.  Court grants and if arrested orders defendant to serve 6 days in jail.
Order to show cause hearing on May 24, 2017 at 10:00 am.
for order to show cause.
47 hours

Clerked by AP. 
Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CM151, 15CF466,15CF462 AND 15CF188

15CM151
Count #3:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
IMPOSED & STAYED 
Count #390 days jail  (with huber and good time and 9 days credit)
Count #4 - 30 days jail   (with huber and good time) to run consecutive with count #3.
2 years probation (probation is concurrent)
AODA
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge, but no sample.

15CF466
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged misdemeanor bail jumping, and possession of drug paraphernalia)

15CF462
Count #1:  State moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged retail theft - court grants)
Imposed and stayed:  60 days jail consecutive to 15CM151 with huber and good time).
2 years probation to run concurrent with other probationary periods.
AODA
47 hours Community Service
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge.  Any cash posted to apply to costs.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

15CF188
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged possession of drug paraphernalia - court grants)  

Court finds it would not be adverse to public interest to grant expunction if defendant is eligible.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court

15CF466 Defense's request for a bond modification. State objects.
Court amends the bond to a $100 cash bond that covers 15CF462 & 15CF466 with same conditions. Plus must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
